metadata.title: Q3 2025 Quarterly Business Review — Enterprise Segment

entities: Priya Nair, Sr. Customer Success Manager
Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations
Nextera Solutions supply chain analytics platform
actions: Reviewed 42 enterprise accounts totaling $38.2M ARR; net retention at 118%
Crestline Logistics expanded from 3 modules to 5 modules, adding predictive demand and supplier risk
Vantage Retail Group renewed 2-year contract with 8% uplift and added 400 new user seats
Polaris Manufacturing flagged as at-risk due to delayed Phase 2 rollout; assigned dedicated CSM
Approved plan to pilot white-glove onboarding for top 10 accounts starting Q4
quotes: Lena Cho: 'Net retention above 115% for the third straight quarter. The cross-sell motion into predictive demand is working.'
Marcus DeWitt: 'Crestline's expansion was driven by their supply chain VP seeing a 22% reduction in stockouts after the first six months.'
Tom Okafor: 'We need to watch Polaris. Their internal champion moved to a different division and the new lead hasn't engaged.'
details: Enterprise segment: 42 accounts, $38.2M ARR, 118% net dollar retention
Crestline Logistics usage: 14,200 daily active queries, up from 8,600 in Q2
Vantage Retail Group: 1,200 total seats, 87% monthly active rate
Polaris Manufacturing: Phase 2 deployment 6 weeks behind schedule, 3 open escalation tickets
White-glove onboarding pilot budget: $180K for dedicated implementation engineers

metadata.title: Weekly Pipeline Review — Week of Sep 8, 2025

actions: Pipeline stands at $14.8M weighted, $29.3M unweighted across 31 active opportunities
BrightPath Health moved to Stage 4 (procurement review) after successful POC showing 31% inventory waste reduction
Orion Semiconductor POC kicked off; deploying 3-node evaluation cluster with 6 months of their component data
TerraFirm Construction demo scheduled for Sep 15 with their COO and Head of Procurement
Lindenfeld Pharma deal pushed to Q4; their budget cycle reset delayed approval by 4 weeks
quotes: Rina Vasquez: 'BrightPath's CFO said the POC numbers were the strongest they'd seen from any vendor this year.'
Jake Thornton: 'Orion's engineering team wants API-level access to our anomaly detection layer. That's a good sign — they're thinking about deep integration.'
Marcus DeWitt: 'Lindenfeld is frustrating but it's a $1.1M deal. We wait. Don't discount, don't rush.'
details: Q3 pipeline: $14.8M weighted / $29.3M unweighted, 31 opportunities
Stage distribution: Stage 1 (8), Stage 2 (9), Stage 3 (7), Stage 4 (5), Stage 5 (2)
BrightPath POC results: 31% inventory waste reduction, 18% faster order fulfillment
Orion POC cluster: 3 evaluation nodes, ingesting 6 months of component lifecycle data
Average sales cycle: 94 days (enterprise), down from 112 days in Q2

metadata.title: H1 2025 NPS Survey Results — Executive Summary
metadata.prepared_by: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations

entities: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations
actions: NPS score: 62 (enterprise), 54 (mid-market), 58 (blended) — up from 51 blended in H2 2024
Top driver of satisfaction: accuracy of demand forecasting models (cited by 71% of promoters)
Top driver of dissatisfaction: onboarding complexity for multi-site deployments (cited by 48% of detractors)
Action plan: simplify multi-site configuration wizard, target 40% reduction in setup steps by Q4
Scheduled follow-up interviews with 12 detractor accounts in September
quotes: Verbatim from Crestline Logistics: 'Your demand forecasting saved us $3.2M in excess inventory costs last year. Best tool we've ever deployed.'
Verbatim from unnamed mid-market detractor: 'Took us 4 months to get our second warehouse online. That's way too long.'
details: Survey response rate: 68% (212 of 312 accounts surveyed)
NPS breakdown: 58 blended (62 enterprise, 54 mid-market)
Promoters: 49%, Passives: 31%, Detractors: 20%
Top feature requests: (1) multi-site config wizard, (2) Slack integration for alerts, (3) custom dashboard builder
Competitive mentions: 14% of respondents evaluated alternatives in past 6 months (down from 22%)

metadata.title: Partner Channel Monthly Update — September 2025

actions: Axion Labs integration: joint connector for real-time data streaming now in beta with 3 mutual customers
Kensington Consulting delivered 4 new Nextera implementations in Q3, generating $1.6M in influenced revenue
Vertex Cloud marketplace listing went live Aug 28; 19 trial signups in first 3 weeks
DataBridge Analytics referred 6 qualified leads in August; 2 converted to Stage 2 pipeline
Partner-sourced pipeline now represents 18% of total weighted pipeline, up from 12% in Q2
quotes: Vanessa Kim: 'The Axion connector is the real deal. Three customers are already testing it and the data latency improvement is measurable — sub-200ms streaming versus batch jobs.'
Marcus DeWitt: 'Kensington is becoming our most reliable channel. Four implementations without a single escalation.'
Lena Cho: 'We should consider a dedicated partner success manager. The channel is growing faster than our support model can handle.'
details: Axion Labs connector beta: 3 mutual customers (Crestline, Vantage, one unnamed), sub-200ms data streaming latency
Kensington Consulting: 4 implementations in Q3, $1.6M influenced revenue, 0 escalations
Vertex Cloud: 19 trial signups since Aug 28 listing, 3 converted to paid ($42K combined MRR)
DataBridge: 6 referrals in August, 2 at Stage 2, average referred deal size $380K ACV
Total partner-sourced pipeline: $2.7M weighted (18% of total), up from $1.4M (12%) in Q2

metadata.title: RE: Renewal Strategy for Q4 Cohort

entities: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations
Priya Nair, Sr. Customer Success Manager
17 enterprise accounts up for renewal in Q4
actions: Identified 17 enterprise accounts ($12.4M ARR) renewing in Q4 2025
Redwood Financial: health score 92/100, usage up 34% YoY, recommend 3-year extension with volume discount
Beacon Shipping: health score 58/100, low adoption in their European operations, schedule executive sponsor call by Sep 22
Stellarwave Media: expressed interest in adding supplier risk module, propose expansion from $340K to $520K ARR
Created tiered renewal playbook: Green (auto-renew + expansion), Yellow (touch-base + value review), Red (executive intervention)
quotes: Lena Cho: 'Q4 renewals are $12.4M. That's 10% of our ARR renewing in one quarter. We need to be surgical.'
Tom Okafor: 'Beacon's European team logged in 11 times total in August. That's a red flag — they're paying for 200 seats and using 23.'
Marcus DeWitt: 'Stellarwave's COO told me at dinner last week they want to consolidate from three supply chain tools to one. That's our expansion play.'
details: Q4 renewal cohort: 17 enterprise accounts, $12.4M ARR at stake
Health score distribution: Green (>80) = 11 accounts, Yellow (60-80) = 4 accounts, Red (<60) = 2 accounts
Redwood Financial: 1,800 seats, 91% MAU, 34% YoY usage growth, health score 92
Beacon Shipping: 200 seats (EU), 23 MAU (11.5%), health score 58, zero API calls from EU instance in 3 weeks
Stellarwave Media: 3 existing supply chain tools, consolidation budget approved internally per COO

metadata.title: Customer Support Metrics — Week 37 (Sep 8-14)
metadata.prepared_by: Rajiv Patel, Head of Customer Support

entities: Rajiv Patel, Head of Customer Support
actions: Total tickets: 287 (down 8% from 312 in Week 36)
Median first response time: 2.1 hours (target: <4 hours)
Resolution rate within SLA: 94.1% (target: >90%)
Top issue: data connector timeouts for SAP integration (47 tickets, up 22%)
Escalated to engineering: SAP connector memory leak identified, patch scheduled for Sep 19 release
quotes: Rajiv Patel: 'The SAP connector issue is our top ticket generator this week. Engineering confirmed it's a memory leak in the connection pooling layer. Patch is in QA now.'
Rajiv Patel: 'Outside of SAP, our ticket volume is actually trending down. The new self-service knowledge base is deflecting about 15% of routine queries.'
details: Week 37 tickets: 287 total (Tier 1: 198, Tier 2: 64, Tier 3: 25)
Median first response: 2.1 hours, median resolution: 18.4 hours
SLA compliance: 94.1% (270/287 resolved within SLA)
SAP connector tickets: 47 (16.4% of total), root cause: memory leak in connection pooling
Knowledge base deflection rate: 15.2% (estimated 51 queries deflected)
CSAT on resolved tickets: 4.3/5.0 (up from 4.1 in Week 36)

metadata.title: Q3 Close-Out Forecast and Q4 Planning

entities: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations
actions: Q3 enterprise bookings: $8.7M against $9.2M target (94.6% attainment, 8 days remaining)
Forecast to close Q3 at $9.4M with BrightPath expected to sign by Sep 29
Q4 pipeline coverage: 3.2x ($47.1M unweighted against $14.8M target)
Recommended adding 2 enterprise AEs in Q4 to handle increased pipeline volume
Lindenfeld Pharma moved to Q4 commit; budget approval now confirmed for October cycle
quotes: Marcus DeWitt: 'We'll beat Q3 target if BrightPath closes on schedule. Their procurement team sent the redline yesterday — it's minor stuff.'
David Aldric: 'Pipeline coverage at 3.2x is healthy. But I want to see conversion rates hold. Last year we had 3.5x coverage and only hit 101% because deals slipped.'
Tom Okafor: 'The mid-market pipeline is actually stronger than enterprise right now. We should consider whether the two new AEs should be mid-market instead.'
details: Q3 bookings: $8.7M closed / $9.2M target / forecast $9.4M (102% with BrightPath)
Q3 deals closed: 14 (7 new logos, 7 expansions), avg deal size $621K
Q4 target: $14.8M bookings, pipeline coverage 3.2x ($47.1M unweighted)
Win rate Q3: 34% (enterprise), 41% (mid-market), blended 37%
Average selling price trending up: $621K (Q3) vs $548K (Q2) vs $492K (Q1)

metadata.title: Customer Advisory Board Meeting Recap — Fall 2025 Session

actions: Presented 2026 product roadmap themes: AI-driven scenario planning, multi-tier supplier visibility, sustainability metrics
Crestline requested deeper integration with their logistics management platform for end-to-end visibility
Redwood Financial asked about SOC 2 Type II timeline; confirmed completion expected Q1 2026
Vantage Retail pushed for mobile-first dashboards for store managers
NovaTech suggested an open API marketplace for custom connectors
Advisory Board voted top priorities: (1) scenario planning, (2) mobile dashboards, (3) API marketplace
quotes: Crestline VP Supply Chain: 'We've reduced stockouts 22% but we still can't see past our Tier 1 suppliers. Multi-tier visibility would be a game-changer.'
Redwood Financial CTO: 'SOC 2 Type II is a hard requirement for our compliance team. We need that cert by Q1 or we'll have to evaluate alternatives.'
Vantage Retail COO: 'Our store managers don't sit at desks. If the analytics aren't on their phone, they don't exist.'
David Aldric: 'This is exactly the kind of feedback that shapes our roadmap. We're building Nextera for the long haul and your input is how we get there.'
details: Advisory Board composition: 7 enterprise customers representing $9.8M combined ARR
Roadmap themes presented: AI scenario planning (H1 2026), multi-tier supplier visibility (Q2 2026), sustainability metrics (H2 2026)
Priority vote results: scenario planning (6/7), mobile dashboards (5/7), API marketplace (4/7)
SOC 2 Type II audit: fieldwork begins November 2025, completion target Q1 2026
Action items: 12 items assigned to product and engineering teams, review in 6 weeks

metadata.title: Implementation Status Report — Cascade Beverage Co.

entities: Priya Nair, Sr. Customer Success Manager
Maya Torres, Cascade Project Sponsor (VP Operations)
actions: Completed data mapping for 8 of 14 ERP integrations; 6 remaining require custom middleware
Ingested 18 months of historical purchase order data (1.2M transactions)
Identified schema mismatch in Cascade's warehouse management system; workaround deployed using translation layer
Scheduled UAT for October 6 with Cascade's operations team at their Denver HQ
Added second integration engineer (Lisa Park) to handle custom middleware development
quotes: Derek Huang: 'The SAP integrations are clean but their warehouse management system uses a legacy schema that doesn't map to our standard connectors. We've built a translation layer that handles it.'
Maya Torres (Cascade): 'We're excited about the UAT milestone. Our Denver team has been asking when they'll get hands on the dashboards.'
Priya Nair: 'Cascade is complex but on track. The schema issue cost us 3 days but we've absorbed it within the original 60-day window.'
details: Cascade Beverage: 14 ERP integrations total (8 complete, 6 pending custom middleware)
Data ingested: 1.2M historical purchase orders (18 months), 23,000 SKUs mapped
6 warehouse locations: Denver (HQ), Phoenix, Atlanta, Chicago, Dallas, Portland
Schema mismatch: legacy WMS uses non-standard product codes; translation layer maps to Nextera taxonomy
UAT scheduled: October 6, Denver HQ, 12 Cascade participants, 3 Nextera engineers on-site
Go-live target: October 20 (Day 56 of 60-day playbook)

Aisha Obi: 'Atlas is a top-5 global logistics company. I can't name them yet but this would be our largest single deal ever if it converts. POC starts Oct 13.'

metadata.title: RE: Axion Labs Connector — Customer Feedback Summary

entities: Vantage Retail Group (beta customer for connector)
actions: Collected feedback from all 3 beta customers on Axion Labs real-time data connector
Crestline reports 94% reduction in data latency (from 15-minute batch to sub-200ms streaming)
Vantage found 2 edge cases where connector drops messages during SAP batch export windows
GreenLeaf Supply confirmed connector works with their custom Kafka pipeline, no modifications needed
Axion Labs agreed to fix the SAP batch export edge case in their next release (target Oct 10)
quotes: Vanessa Kim: 'All three beta customers want to move to GA. The feedback is overwhelmingly positive. The SAP edge case is the only blocker and Axion is on it.'
Crestline feedback: 'The streaming connector eliminated our overnight batch dependency entirely. Our morning planning meetings now use real-time data instead of yesterday's numbers.'
Vantage feedback: 'Works great 99% of the time. We hit a glitch during our 2AM SAP export window — the connector dropped about 200 messages over 10 minutes. Need that fixed before GA.'
Lena Cho: 'This is exactly the kind of partnership that drives retention. Customers are seeing measurable value from the integration, not just a logo on a slide.'
details: Axion connector beta: 3 customers, 6 weeks of testing, GA target October 2025
Crestline: latency improvement from 15min batch to sub-200ms streaming, zero data loss in 6 weeks
Vantage: 2 message-drop events during SAP batch windows (~200 messages each, <0.01% of daily volume)
GreenLeaf Supply: custom Kafka pipeline compatibility confirmed, no custom code required
Joint GA announcement planned for October 15 pending SAP edge case fix

metadata.title: Q3 2025 Churn Analysis and Prevention Report
metadata.prepared_by: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations

entities: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations
actions: Q3 gross churn: $520K ARR across 4 accounts (0.43% of $120M ARR base)
Net revenue retention: 118% (Q3), driven by $6.2M in expansions offsetting $520K churn
MidAtlantic Distributors churned due to internal budget cuts (acquired by larger company, consolidated tools)
Coastal Freight Services churned citing switch to competitor with native TMS integration
Implemented predictive churn model: identifies at-risk accounts 90 days ahead with 78% accuracy
quotes: Tom Okafor: 'Four churns in Q3 totaling $520K. Two were uncontrollable — MidAtlantic got acquired and the new parent had their own tools. The other two are learnable.'
Lena Cho: 'Coastal's churn stings. They wanted native TMS integration and we told them it was on the roadmap. It's been on the roadmap for a year. We need to ship it or stop promising it.'
Tom Okafor: 'The predictive model flagged Coastal 87 days before they churned. We engaged but the product gap was real. Prediction without product isn't enough.'
details: Q3 churn: 4 accounts, $520K ARR (gross churn rate 0.43%)
Churned accounts: MidAtlantic ($210K, acquired), Coastal Freight ($145K, competitor), 2 SMB accounts ($165K combined, budget)
Net revenue retention: 118% ($6.2M expansions - $520K churn on $120M base)
Predictive churn model: logistic regression on 14 features (usage, support tickets, NPS, login frequency, etc.)
Model accuracy: 78% recall at 90-day horizon, 64% precision (some false positives in seasonal businesses)
Q4 at-risk accounts flagged by model: 6 accounts totaling $890K ARR

actions: Mid-market Q3 bookings: $4.1M against $3.8M target (108% attainment)

GreenLeaf Supply expanded to add supplier risk module after Axion connector beta success
Pacific Coast Packaging flagged red: key user (VP Procurement) left the company, usage dropped 40%
quotes: Nadia Ferraro: 'Mid-market overperformed at 108%. The Vertex Cloud marketplace is our secret weapon here — 4 of our 11 new logos came through that channel.'
Tom Okafor: 'Mid-market average deal size is up to $168K. A year ago it was $120K. The upsell motion is working.'
Lena Cho: 'Pacific Coast lost their champion. We need to find the new decision-maker fast — their renewal is in 90 days.'
details: Mid-market segment: 146 accounts, $21.4M ARR, 112% net retention
Q3 bookings: $4.1M / $3.8M target = 108% attainment
New logos: 11 (4 from Vertex Cloud, 3 from DataBridge referrals, 2 inbound, 2 outbound)
Average ACV: $168K (up from $120K YoY), average seats: 85
GreenLeaf expansion: $180K → $260K ARR (+44%), added supplier risk module
Pacific Coast: usage dropped from 340 to 204 daily queries after VP Procurement departure

metadata.title: DRAFT Case Study: Crestline Logistics — From Reactive to Predictive Supply Chain

entities: Nextera Solutions supply chain analytics platform
actions: Drafted 2,500-word case study documenting Crestline's 18-month journey with Nextera
Key results: 22% reduction in stockouts, $3.2M saved in excess inventory, 14,200 daily active queries
Highlighted Axion Labs connector as enabling real-time visibility (from 15-min batch to sub-200ms)
Submitted to Crestline legal for approval; estimated 2-week review cycle
Planned distribution: website, sales collateral, Vertex Cloud marketplace, Kensington partner materials
quotes: Crestline VP Supply Chain (draft quote): 'Nextera transformed how we manage our supply chain. We went from reacting to disruptions to predicting them. The 22% stockout reduction translated directly to $3.2M in savings.'
Marketing Lead: 'This is our strongest enterprise case study yet. The numbers are concrete and the Axion connector angle gives it a technology-forward narrative.'
Lena Cho: 'Make sure the Axion section is factual — streaming latency numbers, batch elimination. No vague claims. Crestline's legal team will check everything.'
details: Case study timeline: Crestline deployed Nextera January 2024, full rollout completed June 2024
Metrics: 22% stockout reduction, $3.2M inventory savings, 14,200 daily queries (up from 2,100 at launch)
Modules deployed: core analytics, anomaly detection, supplier risk, predictive demand, Axion streaming connector
Deployment scale: 8 distribution centers, 1,400 seats, 340 suppliers tracked
Axion connector impact: batch latency eliminated, real-time planning meetings adopted across 6 of 8 DCs

metadata.title: Sales & CS All-Hands Meeting Recap — October 2025
attendees: Full Sales and Customer Success teams

entities: Full sales and CS organization (~45 people)
actions: Q3 final results presented: $13.55M total bookings ($9.45M enterprise + $4.1M mid-market) against $13.0M combined target (104% attainment)
Company ARR updated to $124.8M (up from $120M at start of Q3)
Announced President's Club qualification: 6 reps hit 120%+ attainment, trip to Costa Rica in February
CEO Aldric spoke about 2026 vision: expand into new verticals (pharma, automotive), invest in AI capabilities
Q4 kickoff: $14.8M enterprise + $4.2M mid-market targets ($19.0M combined)
quotes: Marcus DeWitt: 'Q3 was our best quarter ever. $13.55M in total bookings, 104% attainment. Every segment overperformed. Take a moment to appreciate that.'
Lena Cho: 'Net retention hit 118% in enterprise and 112% in mid-market. That means our existing customers are growing with us, which is the strongest signal of product-market fit.'

David Aldric: 'I want to be clear about where we're headed. We're investing in AI-driven scenario planning, we're entering pharma and automotive, and we're doing it as an independent company building for the next decade. This is a marathon, not a sprint.'
Nadia Ferraro: 'Mid-market is becoming a real growth engine. The Vertex Cloud channel alone generated 4 new logos. We're going to triple down on marketplace partnerships in Q4.'
details: Q3 combined bookings: $13.55M (enterprise $9.45M at 103%, mid-market $4.1M at 108%)
ARR milestone: $124.8M (up $4.8M in Q3)
President's Club qualifiers: Rina Vasquez (142%), Aisha Obi (131%), Jake Thornton (124%), 3 mid-market reps
Q4 target: $19.0M combined ($14.8M enterprise, $4.2M mid-market)
2026 vertical expansion: pharma (Lindenfeld as anchor), automotive (pipeline development in Q4)

metadata.title: Weekly Pipeline Review — Week of Oct 13, 2025

entities: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations
actions: Orion Semiconductor: formal proposal delivered Oct 14, procurement review initiated, expected close Nov 15
Atlas POC: 6 of 8 DCs now ingesting, preliminary results show 19% improvement in shipment routing efficiency
Lindenfeld Pharma: budget approved, RFP issued Oct 10, Nextera invited to respond (1 of 3 vendors)
Pinnacle Foods: discovery complete, customized demo scheduled Oct 22 at their Chicago HQ
TerraFirm Construction re-engaged through Kensington; second demo scheduled Oct 24
quotes: Jake Thornton: 'Orion proposal is in. Their procurement team has it. CTO told me privately he's recommending us — the 28% accuracy improvement sealed it.'
Aisha Obi: 'Atlas is exceeding expectations. Six DCs ingesting and the preliminary routing data is already showing 19% efficiency gains. Their SVP of Operations flew to see the dashboard in person.'
Rina Vasquez: 'Lindenfeld RFP landed. We're one of three. I've already started pulling in our pharma subject matter expert for the technical sections.'
Marcus DeWitt: 'Four mega-deals in active stages. If we close even two of Atlas, Orion, Lindenfeld, and Pinnacle, Q4 is going to be extraordinary.'
details: Q4 pipeline: $17.4M weighted / $52.3M unweighted / 3.6x coverage
Atlas POC: 6/8 DCs ingesting, 4.2TB data processed, 19% shipment routing efficiency improvement
Orion: proposal at $520K ACV, 18-month term, expected close Nov 15
Lindenfeld RFP: 3 vendors shortlisted, response due Oct 31, decision expected November
Pinnacle demo: Oct 22, Chicago HQ, 8 Pinnacle executives attending including CEO
TerraFirm: re-engaged via Kensington Consulting, second demo Oct 24

metadata.title: Go-Live Report: Cascade Beverage Co. and Ridgeline Auto Parts

entities: Frank Reeves, Ridgeline Head of Supply Chain
actions: Cascade Beverage: go-live completed Oct 14 (Day 50 of 60), all 6 warehouses active, 14/14 integrations live
Ridgeline Auto Parts: go-live completed Oct 13 (Day 31 of 60), ahead of schedule, 4 distribution centers active
Cascade UAT: zero critical defects, 3 minor issues resolved same-day during Denver on-site
Ridgeline early success: anomaly detection flagged a supplier pricing discrepancy in first 48 hours ($43K overpayment)
Both accounts transitioned from implementation to ongoing CSM support
quotes: Maya Torres (Cascade): 'Your team delivered exactly what they promised. All six warehouses, all fourteen integrations, on time. That almost never happens with enterprise software.'
Frank Reeves (Ridgeline): 'We've been live for three days and your anomaly detection already caught a $43K pricing error from one of our suppliers. That more than pays for the first quarter.'
Derek Huang: 'Two go-lives in one week, both ahead of schedule, zero critical issues. The 60-day playbook is working. Lisa deserves a lot of credit for the Cascade middleware.'
Priya Nair: 'Both accounts are set up with health monitoring. I'll check in at Day 30 post-go-live to make sure adoption is tracking.'
details: Cascade Beverage: go-live Day 50/60, 6 warehouses, 14 integrations, 23,000 SKUs, 1.2M historical orders loaded
Cascade UAT: 0 critical defects, 3 minor (cosmetic dashboard issues), all resolved during Oct 6 Denver session
Ridgeline Auto Parts: go-live Day 31/60, 4 DCs, 180K parts catalog, 8 supplier feeds connected
Ridgeline early win: anomaly detection flagged supplier pricing discrepancy, $43K overpayment identified within 48 hours
September onboarding cohort: 3/3 customers live (NovaTech Sep 18, Cascade Oct 14, Ridgeline Oct 13)
Average time-to-value: 41 days across cohort (target: 60 days)

metadata.title: Customer Health Dashboard — Monthly Snapshot (October 2025)
metadata.prepared_by: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations

entities: Tom Okafor, Head of Revenue Operations
actions: Customer count: 318 accounts (42 enterprise, 146 mid-market, 130 SMB), up 6 net new in October
Total ARR: $124.8M (enterprise $41.2M, mid-market $21.4M, SMB $8.2M, expansions in-quarter $4.0M pending)
Overall health score distribution: Green 78%, Yellow 14%, Red 8%
Platform uptime: 99.97% (September), SLA target 99.9%
Product usage: 2.1M daily queries across all customers (up 18% QoQ)
quotes: Tom Okafor: 'We crossed 2 million daily queries for the first time in September. That's 18% growth quarter over quarter. Usage is the leading indicator and it's pointing straight up.'
Tom Okafor: 'Red accounts are down from 11% to 8%. The interventions on Polaris and Beacon are working — both moved from Red to Yellow this month. Still work to do but trending right.'
details: Customer base: 318 accounts (42 enterprise, 146 mid-market, 130 SMB)
ARR: $124.8M total (enterprise 33%, mid-market 17%, SMB 7%, pending expansions 3%)
Health scores: Green 248 (78%), Yellow 44 (14%), Red 26 (8%)
Platform metrics: 99.97% uptime, 2.1M daily queries, 847ms avg query response time
Support: 1,147 tickets in September, 93.8% SLA compliance, 4.2/5.0 CSAT
Churn: 0 accounts churned in October (to date), Q4 forecast churn $310K (2 SMB accounts)
